name: Debt Dependency
title: Highest Multilateral Debt Service
description: In 2023, Yemen's multilateral debt service accounted for 100% of its public and publicly guaranteed debt service, indicating a heavy reliance on multilateral financial support.

name: Government Spending Surge
title: Rapid Growth in Government Expenditure
description: Yemen experienced a significant increase in government final consumption expenditure, growing by 47.24% in 2018, highlighting a surge in public spending.

name: Investment Boom
title: Exceptional Growth in Capital Formation
description: In 2018, Yemen witnessed an extraordinary growth of 181.82% in both gross fixed and gross capital formation, indicating a substantial investment in infrastructure and development.

name: Anemia Alarm
title: High Prevalence of Anemia Among Women and Children
description: As of 2019, 61.5% of women of reproductive age and 79.5% of children aged 6-59 months in Yemen were affected by anemia, reflecting a significant public health challenge.

name: Underweight Woes
title: High Rates of Underweight Children
description: In 2022, 40.7% of children under five in Yemen were underweight, with 39.6% of females and 41.7% of males affected, indicating severe nutritional deficiencies.

name: Injury Impact
title: Significant Mortality from Injuries
description: In 2019, injuries accounted for 19.49% of total deaths in Yemen, highlighting the impact of conflict and accidents on the population's health.

name: Trade Ties
title: Full Binding Coverage on Trade Products
description: By 2017, Yemen achieved 100% binding coverage on all and primary products, ensuring comprehensive trade agreements and tariff commitments.

name: Food Export Focus
title: Dominance of Food in Merchandise Exports
description: In 2019, food exports constituted 99.29% of Yemen's merchandise exports, underscoring the country's reliance on agricultural products for trade.

name: Financial Desert
title: Lowest Financial Inclusion
description: In 2022, only 19.53% of Yemen's population aged 15+ had an account at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider, with a mere 5.01% among young adults aged 15-24.

name: Energy Sippers
title: Minimal Energy Consumption
description: Yemen's energy use per capita was just 68.95 kg of oil equivalent in 2022, indicating one of the lowest energy consumption rates globally.

name: Governance Challenges
title: Low Government Effectiveness
description: In 2023, Yemen ranked in the bottom percentile for government effectiveness, with a percentile rank of just 0.47.

name: Budget Blues
title: Poor Financial Management
description: Yemen's CPIA quality of budgetary and financial management rating was at the lowest score of 1 in 2023, reflecting significant challenges in fiscal governance.

name: Gender Gap
title: Low Female Participation
description: In 2024, Yemen had one of the lowest female labor force participation rates globally, with only 5.10% of women aged 15-64 participating.

name: Trade Isolation
title: Minimal High-Income Exports
description: In 2023, only 0.12% of Yemen's merchandise exports were directed to high-income economies, indicating limited trade connections with wealthier nations.

name: Logistics Lag
title: Challenging Shipment Arrangements
description: Yemen scored 1.7 on the logistics performance index for ease of arranging competitively priced shipments in 2022, highlighting logistical challenges.

name: Rule of Law Struggles
title: Weak Rule of Law
description: Yemen's rule of law percentile rank was at the lower bound of 0.94 in 2023, indicating significant challenges in legal governance.

name: Regulatory Hurdles
title: Low Regulatory Quality
description: In 2023, Yemen's regulatory quality was in the lowest percentile rank, with a lower bound of 0.47, reflecting regulatory challenges.

name: Gender Representation Gap
title: Minimal Female Representation
description: In 2020, women held only 0.33% of seats in Yemen's national parliament, highlighting a significant gender representation gap.
